original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: Similarly, Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom

original: 'jig rten ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten ston pa yin te /
translated: teaches the world.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, in that way

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis de bzhin nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya bar gyur pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid thugs su chud cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis de bzhin nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya bar gyur pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid thugs su chud cing /
translated: the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha has realized the suchness of all phenomena, by means of which suchness he has become a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a perfectly enlightened Buddha.🔽He has realized the unmistaken suchness and the unaltered suchness.”

original: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid thugs su chud do; ;rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid thugs su chud do; ;rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽'di lta ste /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / 'di lta ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid ni /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽this suchness of all phenomena,

original: zab pa lags so //
analyzed: zab pa lags so //
translated: this unmistaken suchness and unaltered suchness, this perfection of wisdom, is profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin nyid 'di ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'di ni /
translated: this suchness

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub snang bar bgyis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub snang bar bgyis so //
translated: the light of the enlightenment of the Lord Buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / gang zag lta ba phun sum tshogs par gyur pa rnams dang / dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa rnams ma gtogs par su zhig 'di la mos par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / gang zag lta ba phun sum tshogs par gyur pa rnams dang / dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa rnams ma gtogs par su zhig 'di la mos par 'gyur /
translated: who else but the irreversible Bodhisattvas, the persons who have attained the perfection of the view, and the Arhats whose impurities have been exhausted, could believe in this?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: chos 'di dag ni /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni /
translated: these dharmas

original: zab ste / de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bstan pa lags so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis @202a *//
analyzed: zab ste / de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bstan pa lags so // bcom ldan 'das kyis @202a *//
translated: are taught by the Tathagata after he has fully known them.

original: bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / 'di ltar /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / 'di ltar /
translated: The Lord:🔽So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

original: de bzhin nyid ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni /
translated: For,🔽Subhuti, the Suchness of form, etc.

original: mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: mi zad pa'o //
translated: is inexhaustible.

original: ci'i phyir mi zad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi zad ce na /
translated: And why is it inexhaustible?🔽Because the Suchness of form, etc.🔽is inexhaustible.🔽And why is it inexhaustible?

original: chos thams cad mi zad pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid mi zad pa'o; ;rab 'byor /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi zad pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid mi zad pa'o; ;rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Because all dharmas are inexhaustible.🔽And why are all dharmas inexhaustible?

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid 'di ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid 'di ni /
translated: Because the Suchness of all dharmas is inexhaustible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly awakened Buddha, with correct understanding and correct knowledge, has taught this Dharma discourse that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, good in the end, with its own meaning, with its own phrasing, complete, full of meaning,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: in the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines,🔽called “The Teaching of the World.”

original: 'jig rten bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste /🔽bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis pa'o ////
analyzed: 'jig rten bstan pa'i le'u zhes bya ste / bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis pa'o ////
translated: Chapter XLII

original: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu ji snyed 'khod pa de dag gis lha'i tsanda gyi phye ma dag khyer nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu ji snyed 'khod pa de dag gis lha'i tsanda gyi phye ma dag khyer nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
translated: Then all the gods of the desire realm and the form realm in the great trichiliocosm gathered divine sandalwood powder and went to the Blessed One. When they arrived, they bowed their heads to the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'khod nas kyang 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'khod nas kyang 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having sat down to one side, those gods who live in the desire realm and those gods who live in the form realm said this to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di ni; zab pa lags na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di ni; zab pa lags na /
translated: this teaching of the perfection of wisdom is deep.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ci'i slad du zab pa lags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ci'i slad du zab pa lags /
translated: why is the perfection of wisdom deep?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Gods,

original: shes @202b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes @202b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: this perfection of wisdom is deep

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zab bo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zab bo //
translated: because it has the character of emptiness.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Gods,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: this perfection of wisdom is deep🔽because it is not something to be appropriated.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'gag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang /🔽rnam par byang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rtag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'gag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dang / mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chad pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rtag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: the characteristic of signlessness, the characteristic of wishlessness, the characteristic of non-performance, the characteristic of non-production, the characteristic of non-cessation, the characteristic of non-affliction,🔽the characteristic of non-purification, the characteristic of non-existence, the characteristic of essence, the characteristic of non-abiding, the characteristic of non-severance, the characteristic of non-permanence,

original: don gcig pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'ong ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'gro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zab bo //
analyzed: don gcig pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'ong ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'gro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zab bo //
translated: the characteristic of non-single meaning, the characteristic of non-different meaning, the characteristic of non-coming, the characteristic of non-going, and the characteristic of space.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Divine princes,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: This perfection of wisdom

original: mtshan nyid de lta bu yin pas na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de lta bu yin pas na /
translated: has such defining characteristics.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi brdar bka' stsal te /🔽don dam par ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi brdar bka' stsal te / don dam par ni /
translated: The Tathagata has taught it as a worldly convention,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: mtshan nyid de dag ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dag ni /
translated: these defining characteristics

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis rnam par 'khrug par byed mi nus so //
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis rnam par 'khrug par byed mi nus so //
translated: cannot be disturbed by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten yang de'i mtshan nyid kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten yang de'i mtshan nyid kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the world with its gods, humans, and asuras has those very characteristics.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: mtshan @203a *// nyid kyis ni /
analyzed: mtshan @203a *// nyid kyis ni /
translated: a defining characteristic

original: mtshan nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do //🔽mtshan nyid kyis ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed do // mtshan nyid kyis ni /
translated: does not disturb a defining characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid mi shes so //🔽mtshan nyid kyis ni /🔽mtshan nyid med pa mi shes so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi shes so // mtshan nyid kyis ni / mtshan nyid med pa mi shes so //
translated: A defining characteristic does not know a defining characteristic.🔽A defining characteristic does not know the absence of a defining characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid med pas kyang mtshan nyid mi shes so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pas kyang mtshan nyid mi shes so //
translated: The absence of a defining characteristic also does not know a defining characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid med pas kyang mtshan nyid med pa mi shes so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pas kyang mtshan nyid med pa mi shes so //
translated: And that which is without characteristics does not know that which is without characteristics.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa gang yin pa de gnyis ka la'ang gang gis shes par byed pa dang / gang shes par byed pa dang / gang la shes par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa gang yin pa de gnyis ka la'ang gang gis shes par byed pa dang / gang shes par byed pa dang / gang la shes par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: in both that which is a characteristic and that which is not a characteristic, there is no intrinsic reality of an agent of knowing, an object of knowing, or knowing.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: mtshan nyid de dag ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dag ni /
translated: these characteristics

original: gzugs kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
translated: are not created by form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pas mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pas mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not created by feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not created by the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not created by the perfections of moral discipline, patience, perseverance, concentration, or wisdom.

original: stong pa nyid thams cad kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not created by any emptiness.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no; ;stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no; ;stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not created by the aspects of the path. It is not created by the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad @203b mkhyen pa nyid kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad @203b mkhyen pa nyid kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not created by the knowledge of all aspects.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Gods,

original: mtshan nyid 'di dag ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di dag ni /
translated: these defining marks

analyzed: mi rnams dang / mi ma yin pa rnams sam / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams sam /
translated: are not of humans or non-humans,

analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams sam / 'jig rten pa rnams sam /
translated: are not of those with outflows or those without outflows,

analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnams sam / 'dus byas rnams sam /
translated: are not of the worldly or the world-transcending,

original: 'dus ma byas rnams ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnams ma yin te /
translated: are not of the compounded or the uncompounded.

original: mtshan nyid thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all defining marks are non-defining marks.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Gods,

analyzed: la la zhig 'di skad du /
translated: if someone were to say

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ni /

analyzed: 'di lta bu yin no //
translated: like this.”

original: zhes zer na /
analyzed: zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that,

analyzed: ci / yang dag par smra bas smra ba yin nam /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: yang dag par smra bas smra ba ma lags so //

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni / 'dus byas ma lags pa'i slad du nam mkha' ni /
translated: the space element

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa /

analyzed: lha'i bu rnams kyis gsol pa /

analyzed: bcom @204a *// ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

translated: the Tathāgata’s unobstructed wisdom, which has fully awakened to those characteristics, and the characteristics in dependence upon which the Tathāgata teaches all characteristics, those characteristics fully awakened to by the Tathāgata🔽are profound.

original: zab lags so; ;bcom ldan 'das /

original: mtshan nyid thams cad yang dag par rab tu bstan pa lags so; ;bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: mtshan nyid thams cad yang dag par rab tu bstan pa lags so; ;bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

analyzed: 'di ltar / de bzhin gshegs pas gang la spyad pas /

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang mtshan nyid thams cad rab tu dbye ba mdzad de /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang mtshan nyid thams cad rab tu dbye ba mdzad de /
translated: having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they make distinctions in all the characteristics,

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye bar mdzad pa nas mtshan nyid thams cad kyi rab tu dbye ba'i bar du mdzad pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bar du rab tu dbye ba mdzad pas /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye bar mdzad pa nas mtshan nyid thams cad kyi rab tu dbye ba'i bar du mdzad pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bar du rab tu dbye ba mdzad pas /
translated: making distinctions in the characteristics of form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, up to making distinctions in all the characteristics, up to making distinctions in the knowledge of all aspects,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas @204b rnams kyi spyod yul 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas @204b rnams kyi spyod yul 'di ni /
translated: this perfection of wisdom, the domain of the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas,

original: zab ste / ngo mtshar lags so //
analyzed: zab ste / ngo mtshar lags so //
translated: is profound. It is amazing.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to; ;lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to; ;lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Sons of the gods,

original: gzugs ni / gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs ni / gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: form is characterized by being able to assume forms.

original: gzugs nyid kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: gzugs nyid kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathagata has fully and perfectly realized that form itself is without a distinguishing mark.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba ni /
translated: Likewise, feeling

original: myong ba'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: myong ba'i mtshan nyid /
translated: is characterized by experience.

original: 'du shes ni /
analyzed: 'du shes ni /
translated: Perception

original: 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid /🔽'du byed rnams ni /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid / 'du byed rnams ni /
translated: is characterized by grasping.🔽Conditionings

original: mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: are characterized by conditioning.

original: rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: Consciousness

original: so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: is characterized by being aware of each object.

original: de'ang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de'ang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathagata has fully and perfectly realized that consciousness itself is without a distinguishing mark.

original: phung po rnams ni /
analyzed: phung po rnams ni /
translated: The aggregates

original: sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: are characterized by suffering.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully and perfectly awakened to the fact that these are not the characteristics of the Tathāgata.

original: khams rnams ni /
analyzed: khams rnams ni /
translated: The elements

original: sbrul gdug pa lta bu'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa lta bu'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: have the characteristic of being like poisonous snakes.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽skye mched rnams ni /
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // skye mched rnams ni /
translated: The Tathāgata has fully and perfectly awakened to the fact that these are not the characteristics of the elements.🔽The sense spheres

original: skye ba'i sgo'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: skye ba'i sgo'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: have the characteristic of being doors to the arising of suffering.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni /
translated: The Tathāgata has fully and perfectly awakened to the fact that these are not the characteristics of the sense spheres.🔽Dependent origination

original: tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: has the characteristic of being a collection.

original: de'ang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs @205a *//🔽rgyas so // sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: de'ang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs @205a *// rgyas so // sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The Tathāgata has fully and perfectly awakened to the fact that this is not the characteristic of dependent origination.🔽The perfection of generosity

original: yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: yongs su gtong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: has the characteristic of being a complete giving.

original: de'ang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de'ang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully and perfectly awakened to the fact that this is not the characteristic of the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of moral discipline

original: gdung ba med pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: gdung ba med pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: has the characteristic of being without torment.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of patience

original: 'khrug pa med pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: 'khrug pa med pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: has the characteristic of being without conflict.🔽The perfection of perseverance

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni; thub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni; thub pa med pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: has the characteristic of being invincible.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of meditation

original: sdus pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: sdus pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: has the characteristic of being collected.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom

original: spong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: spong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: has the characteristic of being free from conceptualization.

original: de'ang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de'ang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Thus-Gone One has fully and perfectly awakened to the absence of characteristics of all of these.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions

original: 'khrug pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'khrug pa med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: have the characteristic of being without conflict.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Thus-Gone One has fully and perfectly awakened to the absence of characteristics of all of these.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun ni /
translated: The thirty-seven factors of awakening

original: nges par 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The defining characteristic of the perfections is to bring about definite emergence.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // stong pa nyid ni /
translated: The Tathāgata has fully and perfectly awakened to the defining characteristic of these as being without defining characteristics.

original: dben pa'i mtshan nyid /🔽mtshan ma med pa ni /
analyzed: dben pa'i mtshan nyid / mtshan ma med pa ni /
translated: Emptiness has the defining characteristic of being void.

original: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid /🔽smon pa med pa ni /
analyzed: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid / smon pa med pa ni /
translated: Signlessness has the defining characteristic of peace.

original: sdug bsngal sel ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal sel ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Wishlessness has the defining characteristic of eliminating suffering.

original: de'ang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽@205b rnam par thar pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de'ang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // @205b rnam par thar pa rnams ni /
translated: The Tathāgata has fully and perfectly awakened to the defining characteristic of these as being without defining characteristics.

original: rnam par grol bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par grol bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The liberations have the defining characteristic of bringing about liberation.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te; stobs rnams ni /
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // de bzhin du sbyar te; stobs rnams ni /
translated: The Tathāgata has fully and perfectly awakened to the defining characteristic of these as being without defining characteristics.

original: shin tu rnam par nges pa'i mtshan nyid /🔽mi 'jigs pa rnams ni /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par nges pa'i mtshan nyid / mi 'jigs pa rnams ni /
translated: The powers have the defining characteristic of being extremely certain.

original: shin tu brtan pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: shin tu brtan pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: The fearlessnesses have the defining characteristic of being extremely stable.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams ni /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams ni /
translated: The detailed and thorough knowledges have the defining characteristic of being able to teach the Dharma.

original: mi chod pa'i mtshan nyid /🔽byams pa chen po ni /
analyzed: mi chod pa'i mtshan nyid / byams pa chen po ni /
translated: It is characterized by being indivisible.

original: phan pa sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid /🔽snying rje chen po ni /
analyzed: phan pa sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid / snying rje chen po ni /
translated: Great loving kindness is characterized by bringing benefit.

original: skyob pa'i mtshan nyid /🔽dga' ba chen po ni /
analyzed: skyob pa'i mtshan nyid / dga' ba chen po ni /
translated: Great compassion is characterized by protecting.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mchog tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid /🔽btang snyoms chen po ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la mchog tu dga' ba'i mtshan nyid / btang snyoms chen po ni /
translated: Great joy is characterized by supreme delight in all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: sems can gyi nyes pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / grags pa ma yin pa dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa la btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi nyes pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / grags pa ma yin pa dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa la btang snyoms su 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni /
translated: Great equanimity is characterized by remaining indifferent to the faults of sentient beings, to their happiness and suffering, to their gain and loss, to their fame and lack of fame, and to their praise and disparagement.

original: mi 'phrog pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mi 'phrog pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha are characterized by being unassailable.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni /
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni /
translated: The Tathāgata has fully and perfectly realized them to be without defining characteristics.

original: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The wisdom of omniscience is characterized by direct perception.

original: de'ang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de'ang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully awakened to the absence of characteristics.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Divine princes,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: it is thus:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: the Tathāgata has fully awakened to the absence of characteristics in all dharmas.

original: des na / de bzhin gshegs @206a *//
analyzed: des na / de bzhin gshegs @206a *//
translated: Therefore,

original: pa ni; chags pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa ni; chags pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the Tathāgata is said to possess unobstructed knowledge.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” Then the Lord said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas skyed pa yin no //
translated: the perfection of wisdom gives birth to the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten ston pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten ston pa'ang yin no //
translated: also reveals the world to the tathāgatas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: the tathāgatas

original: chos 'di la brten cing gnas nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos 'di la brten cing gnas nas 'di lta ste /
translated: are based on and abide in this Dharma, and then

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di la bsti stang mdzad /🔽bla mar mdzad; ri mor mdzad /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos 'di la bsti stang mdzad / bla mar mdzad; ri mor mdzad /
translated: They revere this perfection of wisdom,🔽they honor and worship it.

original: mchod pa mdzad de /
analyzed: mchod pa mdzad de /
translated: They revere, venerate, and worship this perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de bas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na /
translated: “Subhūti, therefore

original: de bzhin gshegs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bsti stang mdzad /🔽bla mar mdzad /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bsti stang mdzad / bla mar mdzad /
translated: the tathāgatas revere, venerate, and worship this perfection of wisdom.

original: ri mor mdzad /
analyzed: ri mor mdzad /
translated: They revere, venerate, and worship it.

original: mchod pa mdzad pa de ni; chos nyid yin no //
analyzed: mchod pa mdzad pa de ni; chos nyid yin no //
translated: That is the nature of things.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the lord buddhas

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las byung ba'i phyir ro // rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas ni /
translated: have come forth from this perfection of wisdom.

original: byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa tshor ba yin te /
analyzed: byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa tshor ba yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, the Tathāgata is grateful and thankful.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa tshor ba yin no //
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata is grateful and thankful.

original: zhes smras pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: zhes smras pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who say that

original: yang dag par smra bas smra ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par smra bas smra ba yin no //
translated: are speaking correctly.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa tshor ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa tshor ba yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how is it that the Tathāgata is grateful and thankful?

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata

original: theg pa des gshegs shing /
analyzed: theg pa des gshegs shing /
translated: has gone by that vehicle,

original: lam @206b des bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: lam @206b des bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: and by that path he has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /🔽theg pa de nyid dang / lam de nyid la bsti stang mdzad /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni / theg pa de nyid dang / lam de nyid la bsti stang mdzad /
translated: the Tathāgata

original: bla mar mdzad; ri mor mdzad /🔽mchod pa mdzad cing yongs su 'dzin la /
analyzed: bla mar mdzad; ri mor mdzad / mchod pa mdzad cing yongs su 'dzin la /
translated: honors, venerates, worships, and makes offerings to that very vehicle and that very path,🔽and he holds them,

original: rjes su yongs su skyong bar mdzad de /
analyzed: rjes su yongs su skyong bar mdzad de /
translated: and he protects them.

original: rab 'byor / de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni /
translated: Subhūti,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa tshor ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa tshor ba yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: that is how you should see the Tathāgata’s gratitude and thankfulness.”🔽“Lord, how is it that the Tathāgata honors, venerates, worships, and makes offerings to that very vehicle and that very path, and holds them, and protects them?”

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byed pa po med pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so; ;lus med pa'i phyir ma byas par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byed pa po med pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so; ;lus med pa'i phyir ma byas par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the Tathāgata has fully awakened to all phenomena as uncreated and unchanging because there is no creator.🔽He has fully awakened to them as uncreated because they are bodiless.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas chos thams cad byas pa med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas chos thams cad byas pa med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgata, having relied on the perfection of wisdom, has fully awakened to all phenomena as uncreated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ma byas pa mkhyen pa dang / ma byas pa rig pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ma byas pa mkhyen pa dang / ma byas pa rig pa'o //
translated: That, Subhūti, is the Tathāgata’s knowledge and vision of uncreatedness.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas don dam par byung ba med pa'i phyir ye shes byas pa med pa chos thams cad la zhugs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas don dam par byung ba med pa'i phyir ye shes byas pa med pa chos thams cad la zhugs so //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the Tathāgata, having relied on the perfection of wisdom, has penetrated all phenomena with uncreated wisdom because they are ultimately non-arisen.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
translated: Subhūti, for that reason

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa yin no //
translated: is the producer of the Tathāgata.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: gang gi tshe chos thams cad skyed pa po ma lags shing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos thams cad skyed pa po ma lags shing /
translated: when all phenomena are not producers

original: ston pa po @207a *//
analyzed: ston pa po @207a *//
translated: and are not

original: ma lags pa'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten 'di ston pa lags /
analyzed: ma lags pa'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten 'di ston pa lags /
translated: demonstrators, how does the perfection of wisdom produce the Tathāgata and demonstrate this world?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said!

original: chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni /
translated: All phenomena

original: skyed pa po ma yin zhing /
analyzed: skyed pa po ma yin zhing /
translated: are not producers

original: ston pa po ma yin no /🔽rab 'byor / ji ltar chos thams cad skyed pa po ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ston pa po ma yin no / rab 'byor / ji ltar chos thams cad skyed pa po ma yin zhing /
translated: and are not demonstrators.

original: ston pa po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ston pa po ma yin zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, why are all phenomena not producers and not demonstrators?

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena

original: stong pa dang / gso ba dang / gsog dang / ya ma brla dang / snying po med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: stong pa dang / gso ba dang / gsog dang / ya ma brla dang / snying po med pa'i phyir te /
translated: are empty, hollow, false, deceptive, and insubstantial.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na; chos thams cad skyed pa po ma yin zhing /🔽ston pa po ma yin no //🔽rab 'byor / ji ltar chos thams cad skyed pa po ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na; chos thams cad skyed pa po ma yin zhing / ston pa po ma yin no // rab 'byor / ji ltar chos thams cad skyed pa po ma yin zhing /
translated: Subhūti, for this reason all dharmas are not producers and are not teachers.

original: ston pa po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ston pa po ma yin zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, how are all dharmas not producers and are not teachers?

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni /
translated: Subhūti, all dharmas

original: gnas pa med pa /
analyzed: gnas pa med pa /
translated: are not established,

original: khongs su gtogs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir te /🔽rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang chos thams cad skyed pa po ma yin zhing /
analyzed: khongs su gtogs pa med pa yin pa'i phyir te / rab 'byor / rnam grangs des kyang chos thams cad skyed pa po ma yin zhing /
translated: and are not included.

original: ston pa po ma yin no //
analyzed: ston pa po ma yin no //
translated: Subhūti, for this reason all dharmas are not producers and are not teachers.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, thus the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin te /
translated: is the producer of the Tathāgata and the teacher of the world.

original: de'ang gzugs ma mthong ba'i phyir ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de'ang gzugs ma mthong ba'i phyir ston pa yin no //
translated: It is a teacher because form is not seen.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ston pa yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ston pa yin te /
translated: It is a teacher because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not seen.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, thus

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig @207b rten ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig @207b rten ston pa yin no //
translated: is the producer of the Tathagata and the teacher of the world.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhuti:

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma mthong ba'i slad du ji ltar ston pa lags /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma mthong ba'i slad du ji ltar ston pa lags /
translated: How does one teach without seeing form, feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness?

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma mthong ba'i slad du ji ltar ston pa lags /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma mthong ba'i slad du ji ltar ston pa lags /
translated: And how does one teach without seeing the knowledge of all modes?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord:

original: rab 'byor / gang gi tshe gzugs la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang gi tshe gzugs la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung na /
translated: When the consciousness which has form as objective support does not occur,

original: rab 'byor / de ltar gzugs ma mthong ba'i phyir ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar gzugs ma mthong ba'i phyir ston pa yin no //
translated: Subhuti, in that way one teaches without seeing form.🔽And so with feeling, etc.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i sems mi 'byung na /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i sems mi 'byung na /
translated: When the mind which has consciousness as objective support does not occur,

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ston pa yin no //
translated: in that way one teaches without seeing consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and so on.

original: gang gi tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bar du mi 'byung na; de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma mthong ba'i phyir ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i bar du mi 'byung na; de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma mthong ba'i phyir ston pa yin no //
translated: When the consciousness that takes the knowledge of all aspects as its object does not occur, in that way the knowledge of all aspects is not seen, and so the Teacher is shown.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, in that way

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: this profound perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin no //
translated: is the producer of the Tathāgata and the teacher of the world.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, how is it that the perfection of wisdom is the producer of the Tathāgata and the teacher of the world?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: Subhūti, in this regard, this perfection of wisdom

original: 'jig rten stong ngo //🔽zhes rjod par byed do //🔽'jig rten stong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten stong ngo // zhes rjod par byed do // 'jig rten stong ngo //
translated: says, ‘The world is empty.’

original: zhes ji ltar rjod ce na /
analyzed: zhes ji ltar rjod ce na /
translated: How does it say, ‘The world is empty’?

original: phung po lnga po rnams kyi 'jig rten stong ngo //🔽zhes rjod do //
analyzed: phung po lnga po rnams kyi 'jig rten stong ngo // zhes rjod do //
translated: It says, ‘The world of the five aggregates is empty.’

original: khams bco @208a *//
analyzed: khams bco @208a *//
translated: How does it say, ‘The world of the five aggregates is empty’?🔽It says, ‘The world of the five aggregates is empty’ because the world of the five aggregates is empty of the five aggregates.

original: brgyad kyi 'jig rten stong ngo //
analyzed: brgyad kyi 'jig rten stong ngo //
translated: The world of the eight is empty.

original: zhes rjod do //
analyzed: zhes rjod do //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: skye mched bcu gnyis kyi 'jig rten stong ngo //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gnyis kyi 'jig rten stong ngo //
translated: The world of the twelve sense bases is empty.

original: zhes rjod do //
analyzed: zhes rjod do //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi 'jig rten stong ngo //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi 'jig rten stong ngo //
translated: The world of the ten wholesome courses of action is empty.

original: zhes rjod do //
analyzed: zhes rjod do //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'i 'jig rten stong ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'i 'jig rten stong ngo //
translated: The world of the four concentrations, four immeasurables, and four formless absorptions is empty.

original: zhes rjod do //
analyzed: zhes rjod do //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'byung ba rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyi 'jig rten stong ngo //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'byung ba rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyi 'jig rten stong ngo //
translated: The world of the twelve links of dependent origination arising through the condition of ignorance is empty.

original: zhes rjod do //
analyzed: zhes rjod do //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi 'jig rten stong ngo //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi 'jig rten stong ngo //
translated: The world of the sixty-two views such as the view of the transitory collection is empty.

original: zhes rjod do //
analyzed: zhes rjod do //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi 'jig rten stong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi 'jig rten stong ngo //
translated: The world of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment is empty.

original: zhes rjod do //
analyzed: zhes rjod do //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi 'jig rten stong ngo //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi 'jig rten stong ngo //
translated: The world of the six perfections is empty.

original: zhes rjod do //
analyzed: zhes rjod do //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten stong ngo //🔽zhes rjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten stong ngo // zhes rjod do //
translated: In the same way, they say that the world of inner emptiness, the world of outer emptiness, the world of outer and inner emptiness, up to the world of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities is empty.

original: de bzhin du stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi 'jig rten stong ngo //🔽zhes rjod do //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jig rten gyi bar du stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi 'jig rten stong ngo // zhes rjod do // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jig rten gyi bar du stong ngo //
translated: In the same way, they say that the world of the ten powers, the world of the four fearlessnesses, the world of the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the world of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha is empty.🔽They say that the world of the knowledge of all aspects is empty.

original: zhes rjod do; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: zhes rjod do; ;rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: in that way

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin no //
translated: is the producer of the tathāgatas and the demonstrator of the world.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni /🔽@208b 'jig rten stong par rig go /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni / @208b 'jig rten stong par rig go /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the tathāgatas🔽know the world to be empty.

original: 'jig rten stong par yang dag par mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'jig rten stong par yang dag par mkhyen to //
translated: They know the world to be empty.

original: 'jig rten stong par rtogs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten stong par rtogs so //
translated: He knows the world to be empty.

original: 'jig rten stong par thugs su chud do //
analyzed: 'jig rten stong par thugs su chud do //
translated: He knows the world to be empty.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, in this way

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin no //
translated: gives birth to the Tathāgata and shows the world.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni / de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong ngo //
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom

original: zhes ston te /🔽'jig rten stong ngo //
analyzed: zhes ston te / 'jig rten stong ngo //
translated: teaches the Tathāgata that the world is empty.

original: zhes ji ltar ston ce na /
analyzed: zhes ji ltar ston ce na /
translated: How does it teach that the world is empty?

original: 'di ltar phung po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po rnams dang / khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang /
translated: It teaches that the aggregates, elements, sense bases, ten virtuous actions, four concentrations, four immeasurables, four formless absorptions, dependent origination,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang /
translated: the sixty-two views such as the view of the transitory collection, the six perfections, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, all the emptinesses, the powers, the fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jig rten stong ngo /🔽zhes ston te /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jig rten stong ngo / zhes ston te /
translated: the correct understandings, the distinct attributes of a buddha, and the knowledge of all aspects are empty of the world.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Thus, Subhūti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin no //
translated: generates the tathāgatas and shows the world.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab par ston te /🔽'jig rten bsam @209a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab par ston te / 'jig rten bsam @209a *//
translated: shows the inconceivable world to the tathāgatas.

original: gyis mi khyab par ji ltar ston ce na /
analyzed: gyis mi khyab par ji ltar ston ce na /
translated: How does it show the inconceivable world?

original: phung po lnga nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab par ston to //
analyzed: phung po lnga nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab par ston to //
translated: the world from the five aggregates to the knowledge of all aspects is taught as inconceivable.

original: de bzhin du shin tu dben pa dang / nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab par ston te //
analyzed: de bzhin du shin tu dben pa dang / nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten bsam gyis mi khyab par ston te //
translated: Similarly, the world from the emptiness of internal phenomena to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is taught as inconceivable.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, that is the way

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin no //
translated: generates the tathāgatas and teaches the world.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten zhi bar ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten zhi bar ston te /
translated: teaches the tathāgatas the world’s peace.

original: 'jig rten ji ltar zhi bar ston ce na /
analyzed: 'jig rten ji ltar zhi bar ston ce na /
translated: How does it teach the world’s peace?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du zhi bar ston te /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du zhi bar ston te /
translated: It teaches the world’s peace from the aggregates, elements, and sense fields to dependent origination and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, it is in this way

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: that the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa dang / 'jig rten ston pa yin no //
translated: is the producer of the Tathāgata and the teacher of the world.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong pa nyid kho nar ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten stong pa nyid kho nar ston te /
translated: teaches the Tathāgata that the world is just emptiness.

original: 'jig rten stong pa nyid kho nar ji ltar ston ce na /
analyzed: 'jig rten stong pa nyid kho nar ji ltar ston ce na /
translated: How does it teach that the world is just emptiness?

original: phung po lnga'i 'jig rten stong pa nyid kho nar ston pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi 'jig rten stong pa nyid kho nar ston te /
