original: ci / gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa gang yin pa de la gzugs dmigs sam /
analyzed: ci / gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa gang yin pa de la gzugs dmigs sam /
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti, is form that is inconceivable, immeasurable, incomparable, innumerable, and equal to the unequaled apprehended?

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa gang yin pa de la rnam par shes pa dmigs sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa gang yin pa de la rnam par shes pa dmigs sam /
translated: Subhūti, is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness that is inconceivable, immeasurable, incomparable, innumerable, and equal to the unequaled apprehended?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa gang yin pa de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs snyam mam /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa gang yin pa de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dmigs snyam mam /
translated: is the knowledge of all aspects that is inconceivable, immeasurable, incomparable, innumerable, and equal to the unequaled apprehended?”🔽“No, Lord.”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ni / ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni / ma lags so //
translated: it is not so.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
translated: “Subhūti, by this one of many explanations,

original: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: all phenomena are inconceivable, immeasurable, infinite, innumerable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor / 'di dag ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di dag ni /
translated: Subhūti, these

original: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yin no //
translated: are all phenomena that are inconceivable, immeasurable, infinite, innumerable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du de bzhin @212b gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste; rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du de bzhin @212b gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste; rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti, likewise, the dharmas of the tathāgatas, the tathāgatas’ dharmas, are inconceivable, immeasurable, infinite, innumerable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni /
translated: Those dharmas of the Tathāgatas,

original: bsam gyis mi lang ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal gyis mi lang ba'i phyir gzhal du med pa dang / dpag gis mi la'ang ba'i phyir dpag tu med pa dang / bgrang gis mi lang ba'i phyir grangs med pa dang / mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa med pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi lang ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal gyis mi lang ba'i phyir gzhal du med pa dang / dpag gis mi la'ang ba'i phyir dpag tu med pa dang / bgrang gis mi lang ba'i phyir grangs med pa dang / mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa med pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yin te /
translated: are inconceivable because they are beyond thought, immeasurable because they are beyond measure, infinite because they are beyond reckoning, innumerable because they are beyond number, and equal to the unequaled because they are beyond equality and inequality.

original: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam grangs des na /
translated: Subhūti, for this reason

original: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yin no //
translated: all dharmas are inconceivable, immeasurable, infinite, innumerable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni /
translated: Subhūti, those dharmas of the Tathāgatas,

original: bsam pa las 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal ba las 'das pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa dang / tshad las 'das pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa dang / bgrang pa las 'das pa'i phyir grangs med pa dang / mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa las 'das pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yin no //🔽rab 'byor / bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: bsam pa las 'das pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal ba las 'das pa'i phyir gzhal du med pa dang / tshad las 'das pa'i phyir dpag tu med pa dang / bgrang pa las 'das pa'i phyir grangs med pa dang / mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa las 'das pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yin no // rab 'byor / bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: because it is beyond thought, it is inconceivable; because it is beyond evaluation, it is unevaluable; because it is beyond measure, it is immeasurable; because it is beyond enumeration, it is innumerable; and because it is beyond the same and different, it is the same as the unevaluable.

original: bsam gyis mi lang ba'i tshig bla dvags so //🔽rab @213a *// 'byor; gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi lang ba'i tshig bla dvags so // rab @213a *// 'byor; gzhal du med pa zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: “Subhūti, inconceivable” is a synonym for “unthinkable.”

original: gzhal gyis mi lang pa'i tshig bla dvags so //🔽rab 'byor / dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba de ni /🔽tshad med pa'i tshig bla dvags so; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: gzhal gyis mi lang pa'i tshig bla dvags so // rab 'byor / dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba de ni / tshad med pa'i tshig bla dvags so; ;rab 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti, unevaluable” is a synonym for “unevaluable.”🔽“Subhūti, immeasurable” is a synonym for “immeasurable.”

original: grangs med pa zhes bya ba de ni /🔽grangs las 'das pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: grangs med pa zhes bya ba de ni /🔽grangs las 'das pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: “Subhūti, innumerable” is a synonym for “innumerable.”🔽“Subhūti, the same as the unevaluable” is a synonym for “the same as the unevaluable.”

original: rab 'byor / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: Subhūti, “equal to the unequaled”

original: mnyam pa med pa dang mnyam pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa dang mnyam pa'i tshig bla dvags so //
translated: is a synonym for “unequaled.”

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos de dag ni /
translated: Subhūti, the dharmas of the tathāgatas

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yin no //
translated: are inconceivable, immeasurable, infinite, innumerable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: rab 'byor / bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Subhūti, “inconceivable”

original: nam mkha' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that space is inconceivable.

original: de bzhin du gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'ang nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'ang nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, “immeasurable,” “infinite,” “innumerable,” and “equal to the unequaled” are the same as space.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, in that way

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rnams ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rnams ni /
translated: the dharmas of the tathāgatas

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa yin te /
translated: and equal to the unequaled.

original: de dag ni /🔽nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis kyang bsam pa'am /
analyzed: de dag ni / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis kyang bsam pa'am /
translated: They are🔽not able to be conceived,🔽measured,🔽estimated,🔽or

original: gzhal ba'am / dpag pa'am /🔽bgrang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: gzhal ba'am / dpag pa'am / bgrang bar mi nus te /
translated: counted by all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and the world with its gods.

original: de ltar na /🔽sangs rgyas rnams kyang @213b dpag tu med la /
analyzed: de ltar na / sangs rgyas rnams kyang @213b dpag tu med la /
translated: Thus,🔽the buddhas are infinite,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang dpag tu med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyang dpag tu med do //
translated: and the qualities of the buddhas are also infinite.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i le'u'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / dpag tu med pa dang / grangs med pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i le'u'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na /
translated: When this Dharma discourse of the inconceivable, immeasurable, infinite, incalculable, and equal to the unequaled was explained,

original: dge slong lnga brgya ni /
analyzed: dge slong lnga brgya ni /
translated: five hundred monks

original: len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: had their minds liberated from defilements with nothing remaining.

original: dge slong ma nyis stong yang len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: dge slong ma nyis stong yang len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: Two thousand nuns also, their minds liberated from the defilements without further clinging.

original: dge bsnyen drug khri ni /
analyzed: dge bsnyen drug khri ni /
translated: Sixty thousand laymen

original: chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
translated: purified the spotless, immaculate Dharma-eye in regard to phenomena.🔽Thirty thousand laywomen

original: dge bsnyen ma sum khri'ang chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
analyzed: dge bsnyen ma sum khri'ang chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba rnam par dag go /
translated: purified the spotless, immaculate Dharma-eye in regard to phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyi khri ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyi khri ni /
translated: Twenty thousand bodhisattvas

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur te /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur te /
translated: attained the patient acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: de dag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis skal pa bzang po 'di nyid la sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar lung bstan to //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /🔽bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i le'u zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis skal pa bzang po 'di nyid la sangs rgyas su 'gyur bar lung bstan to // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i le'u zhes bya ste /
translated: The Blessed One predicted that they would become buddhas in this very fortunate eon.

original: bzhi bcu rtsa gsum pa'o ////
analyzed: bzhi bcu rtsa gsum pa'o ////
translated: This was the chapter on the inconceivable, the fortieth chapter in the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: this perfection of wisdom

original: zab lags so //
analyzed: zab lags so //
translated: is profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: this perfection of wisdom

original: bgyid pa chen pos nye bar gnas pa lags so //
analyzed: bgyid pa chen pos nye bar gnas pa lags so //
translated: is present with great deeds.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: This perfection of wisdom

original: bgyid pa mtshungs pa ma mchis @214a *//
analyzed: bgyid pa mtshungs pa ma mchis @214a *//
translated: is present with unequaled deeds,

original: pa dang / bgyid pa dpag tu ma mchis pa dang / bgyid pa grangs ma mchis pa dang / bgyid pa mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas nye bar gnas pa lags so //
analyzed: pa dang / bgyid pa dpag tu ma mchis pa dang / bgyid pa grangs ma mchis pa dang / bgyid pa mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas nye bar gnas pa lags so //
translated: with immeasurable deeds, with innumerable deeds, and with deeds that are equal to the unequaled.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this had been said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom

original: byed pa chen pos nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa chen pos nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: is present with great deeds.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom

original: byed pa mtshungs pa med pa dang / byed pa dpag tu med pa dang / byed pa grangs med pa dang / byed pa mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa mtshungs pa med pa dang / byed pa dpag tu med pa dang / byed pa grangs med pa dang / byed pa mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: and it is present through an incomparable activity, an immeasurable activity, an innumerable activity, and an activity that is equal to the unequaled.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'dus pa dang / rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir pha rol tu phyin pa drug 'dus pa dang / rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti, the six perfections are included in this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir nang stong pa nyid 'dus pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du 'dus pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir nang stong pa nyid 'dus pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du 'dus pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang /
translated: Subhūti, the inner emptiness is included in this deep perfection of wisdom, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is included in it, and the four applications of mindfulness, four right efforts,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'dus pa dang / rab 'byor /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'dus pa dang / rab 'byor /
translated: four legs of miraculous power, five faculties, five powers, seven limbs of awakening, and eightfold noble path are included in it, Subhūti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo @214b 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu 'dus pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad 'dus pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo @214b 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu 'dus pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad 'dus pa dang /
translated: In this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom, the ten powers of the tathāgatas are subsumed, and the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas are subsumed.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir sangs rgyas kyi sa 'dus pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'dir sangs rgyas kyi sa 'dus pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, in this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom, the level of buddhahood is subsumed, and up to the knowledge of all aspects is subsumed.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste; dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste; dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba /
analyzed: rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba /
translated: a king of royal caste anointed on the head

original: yul gyi mi rnams la mthu che zhing dbang thob pa'i rgyal po'i bya ba dang / yul gyi mi rnams kyi bya ba ci yod pa de dag thams cad blon po byed du bcug na /
analyzed: yul gyi mi rnams la mthu che zhing dbang thob pa'i rgyal po'i bya ba dang / yul gyi mi rnams kyi bya ba ci yod pa de dag thams cad blon po byed du bcug na /
translated: has great power and authority over the people of the country. Whatever the king’s duties are and whatever the people’s duties are, he delegates all of them to his ministers.🔽Whether it is the king’s duties

original: rgyal po'i bya ba'am /
analyzed: rgyal po'i bya ba'am /
translated: the king's activities,🔽🔽

original: yul gyi mi'i bya ba de dag la rgyal po snying las chung zhing khur bor ba yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi mi'i bya ba de dag la rgyal po snying las chung zhing khur bor ba yin no //
translated: The king is not concerned with the activities of the people and has put down his burden.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du nyan thos kyi chos rnams sam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du nyan thos kyi chos rnams sam /
translated: Similarly, Subhūti, all the dharmas of the śrāvakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sam /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams sam /
translated: all the dharmas of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams sam /
translated: all the dharmas of the bodhisattvas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang ci'ang rung ba de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos gang ci'ang rung ba de dag thams cad ni /
translated: and all the dharmas of the buddhas

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i nang du 'dus te /
translated: are included in the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: This perfection of wisdom

original: de dag gi bya ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi bya ba byed pa yin no //
translated: performs their functions.

original: rab 'byor / de bas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: this perfection of wisdom

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byed pa chen pos nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byed pa chen pos nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: is present as the great function of the bodhisattvas.

original: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom

original: byed pa mtshungs pa med pa dang / byed pa dpag tu med pa @215a *//
analyzed: byed pa mtshungs pa med pa dang / byed pa dpag tu med pa @215a *//
translated: is the incomparable function, the immeasurable function,

original: dang / byed pa grangs med pa dang / byed pa mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: dang / byed pa grangs med pa dang / byed pa mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pas nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: and it is present through countless actions and through actions that are equal to the unequaled.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / 'di ltar /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / 'di ltar /
translated: If you ask why,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ni /
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom

original: gzugs la yongs su 'dzin pa med cing /
analyzed: gzugs la yongs su 'dzin pa med cing /
translated: is present without apprehending physical forms,

original: mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yongs su 'dzin pa med cing /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yongs su 'dzin pa med cing /
translated: and it is present without apprehending feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness,

original: mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag la yongs su 'dzin pa med cing /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag la yongs su 'dzin pa med cing /
translated: and it is present without apprehending , up to and including omniscience,

original: mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la yongs su 'dzin pa med cing /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la yongs su 'dzin pa med cing /
translated: and it is present without apprehending the fruit of entering the stream,

original: mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa dang / de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar dag la yongs su 'dzin pa med cing /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa dang / de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar dag la yongs su 'dzin pa med cing /
translated: They are not attached to the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽

original: mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, it is because they do not grasp at and do not settle down on the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ji ltar gzugs la yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis shing /🔽mngon par zhen pa ma mchis par nye bar gnas pa lags /🔽bcom @215b ldan 'das /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ji ltar gzugs la yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis shing / mngon par zhen pa ma mchis par nye bar gnas pa lags / bcom @215b ldan 'das /
translated: how is this perfection of wisdom not grasping at and not settling down on form?

original: ji ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis shing /
analyzed: ji ltar tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis shing /
translated: Lord, how is it that it is not grasping at and not settling down on feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness?

original: mngon par zhen pa ma mchis par nye bar gnas pa lags ji ltar bla na med yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar dag la yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis shing /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa ma mchis par nye bar gnas pa lags ji ltar bla na med yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar dag la yongs su 'dzin pa ma mchis shing /
translated: How is it that they are not attached to the perfection of giving, up to how is it that they are not attached to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?🔽How is it that they are not attached to the perfection of morality, up to how is it that they are not attached to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?🔽How is it that they are not attached to the perfection of patience, up to how is it that they are not attached to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?🔽How is it that they are not attached to the perfection of perseverance, up to how is it that they are not attached to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?🔽How is it that they are not attached to the perfection of concentration, up to how is it that they are not attached to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?🔽How is it that they are not attached to the perfection of wisdom, up to how is it that they are not attached to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: mngon par zhen pa ma mchis par nye bar gnas pa lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa ma mchis par nye bar gnas pa lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: How is it that they are not attached to the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to how is it that they are not attached to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?🔽How is it that they are not attached to the emptiness of external phenomena, up to how is it that they are not attached to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?🔽How is it that they are not attached to the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, up to how is it that they are not attached to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?🔽How is it that they are not attached to the emptiness of emptiness, up to how is it that they are not attached to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?🔽How is it that they are not attached to the emptiness of great extent, up to how is it that they are not attached to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: rab 'byor / khyod kyis gang la yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang la mngon par zhen pa dang / gang yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang mngon par zhen pa'i gzugs de yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod kyis gang la yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang la mngon par zhen pa dang / gang yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang mngon par zhen pa'i gzugs de yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam /
translated: How is it that they are not attached to the emptiness of ultimate reality, up to how is it that they are not attached to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?🔽How is it that they are not attached to the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, up to how is it that they are not attached to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?🔽How is it that they are not attached to the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, up to how is it that they are not attached to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: rab 'byor / khyod kyis gang la yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang la mngon par zhen pa dang / gang yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang mngon par zhen pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa de yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod kyis gang la yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang la mngon par zhen pa dang / gang yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang mngon par zhen pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa de yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam /
translated: How is it that they are not attached to the emptiness of the unlimited, up to how is it that they are not attached to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: How is it that they

original: de ni / ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni / ma lags so //
translated: “No, Lord.”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / khyod kyis gang la yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang la mngon par zhen pa dang / gang yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang mngon par zhen pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam /🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod kyis gang la yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang la mngon par zhen pa dang / gang yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang mngon par zhen pa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam / gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Subhūti, do you see that unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening to which you are attached, to which you are clinging, and in which you are attached and clinging?”

original: de ni / ma lags so //
analyzed: de ni / ma lags so //
translated: “No, Lord.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / legs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / legs so //
translated: The Lord said:

analyzed: legs @216a *// so; ;rab 'byor / ngas kyang gang la yongs su 'dzin pa'am / mngon par zhen pa'am /
translated: “Excellent, Subhūti, excellent!🔽Subhūti, I also do not see a form to which I am attached or clinging,🔽in which I am attached or clinging,

original: gang yongs su 'dzin pa'am /🔽mngon par zhen pa'i gzugs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang yongs su 'dzin pa'am / mngon par zhen pa'i gzugs yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
translated: or to which I am attached or clinging.

original: rab 'byor / ngas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
translated: Subhūti, I also do not see up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin to //
translated: Not seeing them as real, they do not grasp at them.

original: yongs su mi 'dzin pas mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: yongs su mi 'dzin pas mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: Not grasping at them, they do not settle down on them.

original: rab 'byor / ngas kyang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: rab 'byor / ngas kyang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
translated: “Subhūti, I also do not see the buddha stage, the state of omniscience, the state of knowing everything, or the state of a tathāgata as real.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas yongs su mi 'dzin te /
translated: Not seeing them as real, I do not grasp at them.

original: yongs su mi 'dzin pas mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: yongs su mi 'dzin pas mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: Not grasping at them, I do not settle down on them.

original: rab 'byor / de bas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bas na /
translated: “Subhūti, therefore

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis gzugs la yongs su gzung bar mi bya zhing /

analyzed: mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yongs su gzung bar mi bya zhing /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yongs su gzung bar mi bya zhing /

original: mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: and should not settle down on it.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, connect this with🔽each, up to

original: sangs rgyas nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la yongs su gzung bar mi bya zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la yongs su gzung bar mi bya zhing /
translated: They should not grasp at buddhahood, omniscience, knowledge of all aspects, or the Tathāgata.

analyzed: mngon par @216b zhen par mi bya'o //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams kyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the gods of the desire realm and the gods of the form realm said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /

analyzed: brtag par mi nus shing /

original: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma lags la /
analyzed: rtog ge'i spyod yul ma lags la /

analyzed: zhi ba / zhib mo brtag pa'i mkhas pa dang / mdzangs pa'i rig par bgyi ba lags so //
translated: peaceful, and subtle, comprehensible only to the wise and the brilliant.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Lord,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mos pa de dag ni /
translated: those bodhisattvas who believe in this perfection of wisdom

analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal ba rnams la lhag par bgyi ba bgyis pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa lags so //
translated: They have served the victorious ones of the past, and they have been taken care of by spiritual friends.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: sems can gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos pa de dag ni /
translated: those beings who have faith in this profound perfection of wisdom

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed bskyed pa lags so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed bskyed pa lags so //
translated: have planted many wholesome roots.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang dag gnas pa de dag thams cad dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang dag gnas pa de dag thams cad dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang /

analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas su gyur kyang de dag thams cad kyi shes pa gang lags pa dang / spong ba gang lags pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la gdugs gcig bzod pa @217a *//
translated: compared to the knowledge, the abandonment, and the single day’s patience,

original: dang; 'dod pa dang / sems pa dang / 'jal ba dang / dpyod pa dang / rtog pa gang lags pa las /
analyzed: dang; 'dod pa dang / sems pa dang / 'jal ba dang / dpyod pa dang / rtog pa gang lags pa las /
translated: desire, intention, evaluation, discernment, and investigation of this profound perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di lta bu 'di la 'dod cing bzod pa gang lags pa de nyid /

original: chos mchog tu gyur pa lags so //
analyzed: chos mchog tu gyur pa lags so //

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: 'di ltar dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang; rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyi shes pa dang / spong ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / brgyad pa dang; rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyi shes pa dang / spong ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang /
translated: In the same way, the knowledge and abandonment of those who follow faith, those who follow the teachings, those in the eighth stage, and stream-enterers,🔽the knowledge and abandonment of once-returners, non-returners,

analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes rab dang / spong ba gang lags pa de ni /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod pa lags pa'i slad du'o //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to the devas of the desire realm and the devas of the form realm:

analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Devas,

analyzed: legs so // legs so //

original: lha'i bu dag /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag / de de bzhin no //

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /

analyzed: spong ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: the cognition and relinquishment of an arhat,🔽the cognition and relinquishment of a pratyekabuddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod pa yin no //
translated: and the cognition and relinquishment of a bodhisattva great being who has attained the acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: lha'i bu @217b dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu @217b dag /
translated: “Divine princes,

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni /
