original: shes @229b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyis yongs su ma zin la /
analyzed: shes @229b rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyis yongs su ma zin la /
translated: up to they are not embraced by the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis yongs su ma zin pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis yongs su ma zin pas /
translated: They are not embraced by the knowledge of all aspects,

original: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: and they fall to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: They do not go forth to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, in that way

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas yongs su ma zin pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas yongs su ma zin pas /
translated: bodhisattva great beings not embraced by the perfection of wisdom and skillful means

original: nyan thos kyis dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: fall to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.”🔽“Lord, what is the bodhisattva great beings’ skillful means?”

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas yongs su zin la /🔽nyan thos kyi sa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas yongs su zin la / nyan thos kyi sa'am /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings, supported by the perfection of wisdom and skillful means,🔽not fall to the śrāvaka level or

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung zhing /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung zhing /
translated: the pratyekabuddha level,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur zhe na; rab 'byor /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur zhe na; rab 'byor /
translated: and attain unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thog ma kho nar sbyin pa sbyin pa na /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thog ma kho nar sbyin pa sbyin pa na /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, when first giving a gift,

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par mi byed cing /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa sbyin par mi byed cing /
translated: do not give a gift with a thought of ‘I’ and ‘mine.’

original: shes rab kyi bar du sgom par byed de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi bar du sgom par byed de /
translated: Up to they cultivate wisdom.

original: de 'di snyam du /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du /
translated: They think like this:

original: bdag gis sbyin pa sbyin no //🔽sbyin pa 'di sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sbyin pa sbyin no // sbyin pa 'di sbyin par bya'o //
translated: ‘I am giving a gift.🔽I am giving this gift.

original: 'di la sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o //
translated: I am giving a gift to this person.’

original: snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: They do not think like that.

original: shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'ang de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'ang de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Up to the perfection of wisdom, connect this in the same way.

original: de sbyin pa la rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: de sbyin pa la rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: He does not falsely project generosity.

original: sbyin pas rlom sems su mi byed /🔽bdag gi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pas rlom sems su mi byed / bdag gi sbyin pa'o //
translated: He does not falsely project through generosity.🔽He does not falsely project, thinking, ‘I am generous.’

original: snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //🔽de bzhin @230a *//
analyzed: snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do // de bzhin @230a *//
translated: He does not falsely project, thinking, ‘I am practicing generosity.’

original: du sbyar te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: du sbyar te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: In the same way, he does not falsely project up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyis rlom sems su mi byed /🔽bdag gi shes rab bo //
analyzed: shes rab kyis rlom sems su mi byed / bdag gi shes rab bo //
translated: He does not falsely project through wisdom.🔽He does not falsely project, thinking, ‘I am wise.’

original: snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: snyam du rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: He does not falsely project, thinking, ‘I am practicing wisdom.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ni /
translated: Because the perfection of generosity

original: gang gis rlom sems su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du gang gis rlom sems su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis rlom sems su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du gang gis rlom sems su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: does not have the conceptualization by which one would falsely project, and up to the perfection of wisdom does not have the conceptualization by which one would falsely project.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du pha mthar phyin pa yin la; byang chub sems dpa' de'ang pha mtha' yang shes /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du pha mthar phyin pa yin la; byang chub sems dpa' de'ang pha mtha' yang shes /
translated: They have perfected the transcendent perfection of generosity and the other transcendent perfections up to and including the transcendent perfection of wisdom, and they know the limits of those transcendent perfections.

original: pha rol kyang shes te rlom sems su mi byed pa de ni /
analyzed: pha rol kyang shes te rlom sems su mi byed pa de ni /
translated: They have gone to the far end of the perfection of giving, up to the perfection of wisdom, and those bodhisattvas know the far end and know the other side, but they do not falsely project.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa yin no //
translated: They are embraced by the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin cing /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin cing /
translated: They are embraced by the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis yongs su zin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis yongs su zin te /
translated: up to they are embraced by the knowledge of all aspects.

original: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: They do not fall to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they will reach the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na /
translated: Subhūti, that is how

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin cing /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who is upheld by the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin du thabs la mkhas @230b pas yongs su zin te nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du thabs la mkhas @230b pas yongs su zin te nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and similarly is upheld by skill in means will not fall to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.

original: nag po'i phyogs la ji lta ba bzhin du dkar po'i phyogs thams cad la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs la ji lta ba bzhin du dkar po'i phyogs thams cad la'ang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as with the dark side, so it is with the bright side.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines:

original: gru'i le'u zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gru'i le'u zhes bya ste /
translated: The Chapter on the Boat

original: bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa'o ////
analyzed: bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa'o ////
translated: is the forty-fifth.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /🔽bam po sum cu rtsa lnga pa; de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa / bam po sum cu rtsa lnga pa; de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines🔽Chapter LVI🔽The Skill in Means of the Bodhisattvas

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Thus spoke the Lord, and the venerable Subhūti, the Elder, the Bodhisattva Maitreya, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti, and all the others present in that assembly applauded the speech of the Lord.

original: las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should a bodhisattva great being, a beginner, train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi /
translated: How should they train in the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob par 'dod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob par 'dod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: “Subhūti, here a bodhisattva great being, a beginner, who wishes to train in the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity should honor and attend on an excellent teacher.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la slob par 'dod pas /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ston pa gang yin pa'i dge ba'i bshes @231a *//
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la slob par 'dod pas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ston pa gang yin pa'i dge ba'i bshes @231a *//
translated: the perfection of discipline, and the perfection of generosity

original: gnyen dag la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen dag la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: should serve the spiritual friends who teach this perfection of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du slob par 'dod pas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du slob par 'dod pas /
translated: Those who wish to train in the perfection of generosity

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag la bsten par bya /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag la bsten par bya /
translated: should rely on the spiritual friends who teach the perfection of generosity,

original: bsnyen par bya /
analyzed: bsnyen par bya /
translated: should serve them,

original: bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: and should honor them.

original: de dag kyang de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ston te /
analyzed: de dag kyang de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ston te /
translated: They will teach them this perfection of wisdom,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: saying, ‘Come here, son of a good family!

original: tshur shog / khyod kyis sbyin pa gang dang gang sbyin pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngos shig /
analyzed: tshur shog / khyod kyis sbyin pa gang dang gang sbyin pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su sngos shig /
translated: You should transform all the generosity you practice into unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family!

original: tshur shog / khyod tshul khrims gang dang gang bsrungs pa dang / bzod pa bsgoms pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab bsgoms pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos la /
analyzed: tshur shog / khyod tshul khrims gang dang gang bsrungs pa dang / bzod pa bsgoms pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / shes rab bsgoms pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos la /
translated: Whatever morality you have observed, whatever patience you have cultivated, whatever perseverance you have begun, whatever meditative stabilization you have entered, and whatever wisdom you have meditated, you should dedicate all of that to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gzugs las rtog par ma byed cig /
analyzed: khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gzugs las rtog par ma byed cig /
translated: you should not imagine unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening as form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa las rtog par ma byed cig /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa las rtog par ma byed cig /
translated: You should not imagine it as feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las rtog par ma byed cig ;tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rtog par ma byed cig /
analyzed: khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las rtog par ma byed cig ;tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las rtog par ma byed cig /
translated: Do not imagine that it comes from the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, or wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo @231b po nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams las rtog par ma byed cig /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo @231b po nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams las rtog par ma byed cig /
translated: Do not imagine that it comes from the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, or from the applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams las rtog par ma byed cig /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams las rtog par ma byed cig /
translated: Do not imagine that it comes from the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, or path.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad las rtog par ma byed cig /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad las rtog par ma byed cig /
translated: Do not conceptualize the five higher perceptions, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la'ang rtog par ma byed cig /
analyzed: khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la'ang rtog par ma byed cig /
translated: do not conceptualize unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rnam ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la'ang rtog par ma byed cig /
analyzed: rnam ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la'ang rtog par ma byed cig /
translated: Do not conceptualize up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs la mi rtog na /
analyzed: gzugs la mi rtog na /
translated: If you do not conceptualize form,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: you will attain up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi rtog na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi rtog na /
translated: If you do not conceptualize feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: you will attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi rtog /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi rtog /
translated: They do not conceptualize the perfection of generosity, the perfection of conduct, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, or the perfection of meditation.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi rtog /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi rtog /
translated: They do not conceptualize the perfection of insight.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mi rtog /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mi rtog /
translated: They do not conceptualize inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la mi rtog na /🔽yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang @232a *//
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la mi rtog na / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang @232a *//
translated: They do not conceptualize the applications of mindfulness,

original: po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam la mi rtog /
analyzed: po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam la mi rtog /
translated: the correct exertions, the supports for miraculous ability, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, or the path.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mi rtog na /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mi rtog na /
translated: They do not conceptualize the clairvoyances, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they will attain the knowledge of all modes.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: khyod shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
analyzed: khyod shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa na /
translated: when you practice the perfection of wisdom

original: gzugs la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
analyzed: gzugs la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
translated: do not produce desire for form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: gzugs ni / 'dod pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni / 'dod pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form is without desire.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: khyod tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
analyzed: khyod tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
translated: do not produce desire for feeling, perception, volitional forces, or consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness is without desire.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: khyod sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
analyzed: khyod sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
translated: do not produce desire for the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
translated: Do not produce desire for the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, or concentration.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: khyod shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /🔽nang stong pa nyid la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
analyzed: khyod shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'dod pa ma skyed cig / nang stong pa nyid la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
translated: Do not arouse desire for the perfection of wisdom.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
translated: Do not arouse desire for inner emptiness, up to do not arouse desire for the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
translated: Do not arouse desire for the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi @232b yan lag dang / lam rnams kyi bar la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi @232b yan lag dang / lam rnams kyi bar la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
translated: up to do not arouse desire for the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
translated: Do not arouse desire for the five clairvoyances, ten powers, fearlessnesses, detailed and thorough knowledges, or distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: khyod rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la'ang 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
analyzed: khyod rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la'ang 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
translated: do not arouse desire for the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni /🔽'dod pa med cing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni / 'dod pa med cing /
translated: The knowledge of all modes🔽is not a desire,

original: 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and is not something to be desired.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: khyod rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
analyzed: khyod rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
translated: do not produce a desire for the fruit of entering the stream,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
translated: do not produce a desire for the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'dod pa ma skyed cig /
translated: do not produce a desire for the secure state of a bodhisattva,

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: and why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: enlightenment

original: 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is not a desire.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni /
translated: all phenomena

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: zhes chos ston to; ;rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: zhes chos ston to; ;rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer zhing /
translated: “Those bodhisattva great beings who strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening with regard to all phenomena that are empty of their own marks,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba dag ni /🔽dka' ba @233a *//
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba dag ni / dka' ba @233a *//
translated: and who wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: bgyid pa lags so //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bgyid pa lags so // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: are doing what is difficult.🔽“Blessed One, it is so.

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ngag chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang ngag chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub don du gnyer zhing /
translated: Those bodhisattva great beings who strive for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening with regard to all phenomena that are empty of their own marks,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa dag ni /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa dag ni /
translated: and who wish to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: dka' ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dka' ba byed pa yin no //
translated: are doing what is difficult.”🔽“Subhūti, it is so.🔽It is just as you have said.

original: rab 'byor / 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
translated: But, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings

original: chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bur shes nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / rmi lam lta bur shes nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: having understood that all phenomena are like an illusion and like a dream, have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni /
translated: The bodhisattva great beings

original: 'jig rten la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin te /🔽bdag 'jig rten gyi skyob par gyur cig /
analyzed: 'jig rten la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin te / bdag 'jig rten gyi skyob par gyur cig /
translated: have set out for the benefit and happiness of the world.

original: ces bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: ces bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa yin /
translated: They have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, thinking, “May I become the world’s protector.”

original: 'jig rten gyi skyabs su gyur cig /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi skyabs su gyur cig /
translated: They have set out for the world’s refuge.

original: 'jig rten gyi gnas dang / 'jig rten gyi dpung gnyen dang / 'jig rten gyi gling dang / 'jig rten gyi yongs su 'dren pa dang / 'jig rten gyi rten du gyur cig ces bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi gnas dang / 'jig rten gyi dpung gnyen dang / 'jig rten gyi gling dang / 'jig rten gyi yongs su 'dren pa dang / 'jig rten gyi rten du gyur cig ces bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: I will be a world-protector, a world-island, a world-leader, a world-support.’

original: rab 'byor / byang @233b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ji ltar 'jig rten la phan pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang @233b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ji ltar 'jig rten la phan pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings set out to benefit the world?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis sems can rnams 'gro ba lnga las yongs su grol bar byas nas mya ngan las 'das pa 'jigs pa med pa bde ba'i thang la 'god par byed de /

original: rab 'byor / chos thams cad ni /

analyzed: tshul de las mi 'da' 'o //

analyzed: tshul de las mi 'da' 'o //

original: sangs rgyas mang po bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum dag la bsnyen bkur byed byed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par 'gyur ro //

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su brtag par bya'o //

translated: “Subhūti, you should examine whether or not bodhisattva great beings have become attached to this deep perfection of wisdom.”

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag las phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag las phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: Subhuti, you should know that a Bodhisattva-mahasattva who does not turn away from the knowledge of all modes is irreversible.🔽

original: ci / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mngon par zhen par ma gyur tam /
analyzed: ci / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mngon par zhen par ma gyur tam /

original: ci / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de ni /
analyzed: ci / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de ni /

analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa dang / gzhan gyis bstan pa la snying por mi lta'am /

analyzed: @245b ci; phyir mi ldog ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de /

original: gzhan gyi dad pas mi 'gro'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dad pas mi 'gro'am /
translated: goes along with the faith of others,🔽whether a bodhisattva great being who does not turn back from the knowledge of all aspects and who practices this deep perfection of wisdom

original: ci / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de /
analyzed: ci / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de /

analyzed: 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis mi 'phrog gam /

original: ci / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de; sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang /

translated: not lack the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience,

analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar ma gyur tam /

original: ci / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa na /
analyzed: ci / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la spyod pa de; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa na /
translated: when this profound perfection of wisdom is being taught,

original: mi skrag gam /🔽mi dngang ngam /
analyzed: mi skrag gam / mi dngang ngam /
translated: are not frightened,🔽are not terrified,

original: dngang bar mi 'gyur ram /🔽zhum par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: dngang bar mi 'gyur ram / zhum par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: do not become terrified,🔽do not become timid,

original: 'gong bar mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'gong bar mi 'gyur ram /
translated: do not become cowed,

original: de'i yid phyir phyogs par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de'i yid phyir phyogs par mi 'gyur ram /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi 'brel lam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi 'brel lam /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa la mngon par dga'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyan pa la mngon par dga'am /

original: thos @246a *// nas kyang 'dzin tam /
analyzed: thos @246a *// nas kyang 'dzin tam /

original: 'chang ngam / klog gam /
analyzed: 'chang ngam / klog gam /

analyzed: kun chub par byed dam / tshul bzhin du yid la byed dam /

analyzed: de bzhin nyid du nan tan byed dam zhes brtag par bya'o //

analyzed: rab 'byor / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /

original: sngon gyi dus na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yongs su dri ba byas pa dang / bzung ba dang / bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par byas pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi dus na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di yongs su dri ba byas pa dang / bzung ba dang / bcangs pa dang / bklags pa dang / kun chub par byas pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: has in the past asked questions about, taken up, borne in mind, read aloud, mastered, and properly paid attention to this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: 'di ltar / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa na /🔽mi skrag / mi dngang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa na / mi skrag / mi dngang /
translated: when this deep perfection of wisdom is being taught

original: dngang bar mi 'gyur zhing /🔽zhum par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dngang bar mi 'gyur zhing / zhum par mi 'gyur /
translated: is not afraid, is not terrified,🔽and does not become terrified;🔽does not become timid;

original: 'gong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: does not become cowed;🔽and

original: yid phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ba'i steng du thos nas kyang 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ba'i steng du thos nas kyang 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and not only does his mind not turn back, but he also, having heard it, takes it up, bears it in mind, reads it aloud, masters it, and properly pays attention to it.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa na /🔽mi skrag / mi dngang /🔽dngang bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di ston pa na / mi skrag / mi dngang / dngang bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings are taught this profound perfection of wisdom,🔽they are not frightened, not terrified,

original: zhum par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: zhum par mi 'gyur /
translated: and do not become terrified;🔽they are not timid,

original: 'gong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: and they do not become timid;

original: de'i yid phyir phyogs par yang mi 'gyur ba lags na /
analyzed: de'i yid phyir phyogs par yang mi 'gyur ba lags na /
translated: and their minds do not turn back.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @246b des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la ji ltar rnam par dpyad par bgyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po @246b des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la ji ltar rnam par dpyad par bgyi /
translated: Blessed One, how should bodhisattva great beings investigate this profound perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should investigate this profound perfection of wisdom as follows:

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems kyi rgyud rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gzhol bas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems kyi rgyud rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gzhol bas /
translated: Subhuti : The Bodhisattva, the great being, should, with a thought bent on the knowledge of all modes,🔽

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rnam par dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should investigate this deep perfection of wisdom with a mental continuum directed toward the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems kyi rgyud rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gzhol bas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems kyi rgyud rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gzhol bas /
translated: “Lord,🔽how do bodhisattva great beings with a mental continuum directed toward the knowledge of all aspects investigate this deep perfection of wisdom?”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la ji ltar rnam par dpyad par bgyi; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la ji ltar rnam par dpyad par bgyi; bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems kyi rgyud stong pa nyid la gzhol ba dang / stong pa nyid la 'bab pa dang / stong pa nyid la bab pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems kyi rgyud stong pa nyid la gzhol ba dang / stong pa nyid la 'bab pa dang / stong pa nyid la bab pas /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings with a mental continuum directed toward emptiness, with a mental continuum descending into emptiness, with a mental continuum falling into emptiness,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rnam par dpyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rnam par dpyod pa yin no //
translated: investigate this deep perfection of wisdom.”

original: rab 'byor / sems kyi rgyud mtshan ma med pa la gzhol ba dang / smon pa med pa la gzhol ba dang / sems kyi rgyud nam mkha' la gzhol ba dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems kyi rgyud mtshan ma med pa la gzhol ba dang / smon pa med pa la gzhol ba dang / sems kyi rgyud nam mkha' la gzhol ba dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Subhūti, the mind-stream is inclined toward the signless, inclined toward the wishless, inclined toward space,🔽and similarly,

original: rab 'byor / sems kyi rgyud skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa la gzhol ba dang / sems kyi rgyud de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems kyi rgyud skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa la gzhol ba dang / sems kyi rgyud de bzhin nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang /
translated: Subhūti, the mind-stream is inclined toward non-arising, non-cessation, non-affliction, and non-purification, and the mind-stream is inclined toward thusness, the dharma-constituent,🔽the very limit of reality, sameness, the inconceivable,

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / @247a *//🔽mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la gzhol bas /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / @247a *// mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la gzhol bas /
translated: and the unconditioned.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rnam par dpyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rnam par dpyod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, it is because of that that they investigate this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / sems kyi rgyud rmi lam lta bu la gzhol ba dang / sprul pa lta bu la gzhol bas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sems kyi rgyud rmi lam lta bu la gzhol ba dang / sprul pa lta bu la gzhol bas /
translated: Subhūti, the mind-stream is inclined toward a dream, inclined toward an emanation,🔽and similarly,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rnam par dpyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rnam par dpyod pa yin no //
translated: They are investigating this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,🔽the mindstreams of bodhisattva great beings are inclined toward emptiness,🔽so they are investigating this profound perfection of wisdom.🔽They are investigating this profound perfection of wisdom, because the mindstreams of bodhisattva great beings are inclined toward the absence of attributes,🔽the absence of wishes,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud stong pa nyid la gzhol bas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud stong pa nyid la gzhol bas /
translated: the perfection of generosity,🔽the perfection of ethical discipline,🔽the perfection of patience,🔽the perfection of perseverance,🔽the perfection of concentration,🔽the perfection of wisdom,🔽the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽the ten powers of the tathāgatas,🔽the four fearlessnesses,🔽the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽They are investigating this profound perfection of wisdom, because the mindstreams of bodhisattva great beings are inclined toward the knowledge of all aspects,🔽the knowledge of paths,🔽and the knowledge of all things.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rnam par dpyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rnam par dpyod pa yin no //
translated: They are investigating this profound perfection of wisdom, because the mindstreams of bodhisattva great beings are inclined toward the emptiness of internal phenomena,🔽the emptiness of external phenomena,🔽the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena,🔽the emptiness of emptiness,🔽the emptiness of great extent,🔽the emptiness of ultimate reality,🔽the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,🔽the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena,🔽the emptiness of the unlimited,🔽the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end,🔽the emptiness of non-discarded phenomena,🔽the emptiness of inherent existence,🔽the emptiness of all things,🔽the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics,🔽the emptiness of non-apprehension,🔽the emptiness of non-entities,🔽and the emptiness of essential nature.

original: zhes bgyi ba nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud rmi lam lta bu'i bar la gzhol bas /
analyzed: zhes bgyi ba nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud rmi lam lta bu'i bar la gzhol bas /
translated: They are investigating this profound perfection of wisdom, because the mindstreams of bodhisattva great beings are inclined toward the perfection of giving,🔽the perfection of ethical discipline,🔽the perfection of patience,🔽the perfection of perseverance,🔽the perfection of concentration,🔽and the perfection of wisdom.🔽They are investigating this profound perfection of wisdom, because the mindstreams of bodhisattva great beings are inclined toward the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽the ten powers of the tathāgatas,🔽the four fearlessnesses,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rnam par dpyod pa yin no //🔽zhes bka' stsal na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rnam par dpyod pa yin no // zhes bka' stsal na /
translated: the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.🔽They are investigating this profound perfection of wisdom, because the mindstreams of bodhisattva great beings are inclined toward the knowledge

original: ci / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs la'ang rnam par dpyod pa bgyid pa lags sam; tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la'ang rnam par dpyod par bgyid lags sam /
analyzed: ci / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs la'ang rnam par dpyod pa bgyid pa lags sam; tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la'ang rnam par dpyod par bgyid lags sam /
translated: “Lord, do Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas also analyze form, and also analyze feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness?

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la'ang rnam par dpyod pa bgyid lags sam /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la'ang rnam par dpyod pa bgyid lags sam /
translated: And in the same way, do they also analyze up to the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: “Subhuti, Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas

original: gzugs @247b la rnam par dpyod par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzugs @247b la rnam par dpyod par mi byed do //
translated: do not analyze form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la rnam par dpyod par mi byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la rnam par dpyod par mi byed do //
translated: and do not analyze feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Subhuti, Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la rnam par dpyod par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la rnam par dpyod par mi byed do //
translated: do not analyze up to the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / 'di ltar /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / 'di ltar /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni /
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because the omniscience of the buddhas

original: sus kyang ma byas /
analyzed: sus kyang ma byas /
translated: has not been created by anyone,

original: 'gyur bar ma byas /🔽gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
analyzed: 'gyur bar ma byas / gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
translated: has not been transformed,🔽has not come from anywhere,

original: gang du'ang ma song /
analyzed: gang du'ang ma song /
translated: has not gone anywhere,

original: gang na'ang mi 'dug la /🔽yul na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: gang na'ang mi 'dug la / yul na'ang mi gnas /
translated: has not been present anywhere,🔽has not been present in a place,

original: phyogs na'ang mi gnas te /🔽de la ni /
analyzed: phyogs na'ang mi gnas te / de la ni /
translated: and has not been present in a direction.🔽It is not perceived in terms of number,

original: grangs dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba mi dmigs la /
analyzed: grangs dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba mi dmigs la /
translated: coming, or going.

original: gang la grangs dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba mi dmigs pa de ni /
analyzed: gang la grangs dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba mi dmigs pa de ni /
translated: That which is not perceived in terms of number, coming, or going

original: sus kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mi nus te /
analyzed: sus kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mi nus te /
translated: cannot be manifestly and completely awakened to by anyone.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bar gyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na; gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa dang / tshor ba nyid dang / 'du shes nyid dang / 'du byed nyid dang / rnam par shes pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid @248a *//
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi bar gyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de ci'i phyir zhe na; gzugs nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin pa dang / tshor ba nyid dang / 'du shes nyid dang / 'du byed nyid dang / rnam par shes pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid @248a *//
translated: because they will not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening through form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness, or through generosity, ethical discipline, patience, perseverance, meditative stabilization, or wisdom, up to or through the knowledge of a knower of all aspects.

original: yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you ask why, it is because form itself is the knowledge of all aspects, and feeling itself, perception itself, volitional factors themselves, and consciousness itself is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / 'di ltar /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / 'di ltar /
translated: If you ask why,🔽Su­bhūti, it is because the real nature of form,

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: and the real nature of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: de bzhin nyid gcig go /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gcig go /
translated: That is the one thusness.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa 'di ni /
translated: Similarly, the thusness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, and the thusness of the knowledge of all aspects

original: de bzhin nyid gcig go /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gcig go /
translated: are one thusness.

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang /
translated: Similarly, the thusness of the perfections, the thusness of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the thusness of the powers, the fearlessnesses, and the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: and the thusness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: are the thusness of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ni / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: That is the thusness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: 'dod chags 'dul ba'i le'u zhes bya ste /🔽bzhi bcu rtsa bdun pa'o ////
analyzed: 'dod chags 'dul ba'i le'u zhes bya ste / bzhi bcu rtsa bdun pa'o ////
translated: The Chapter on Subduing Desire

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po sum cu rtsa drug pa /
analyzed: bam po sum cu rtsa drug pa /
translated: The Thirty-Sixth Scroll🔽Then the sons of the gods who enjoy desire and form took up divine sandalwood powder

original: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams lha'i tsandan gyi phye ma blangs shing /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams lha'i tsandan gyi phye ma blangs shing /
translated: and
